PCOS Detection Using Multi -Scale Retinex Enhanced Ultrasound Images: A Deep Learning Approach with ImpalaCNN Algorithm

This document excerpt presents a Python code snippet for processing data related to the detection of Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS) using ultrasound images. The code leverages the Kaggle environment and utilizes the Pandas library for data manipulation. Specifically, it iterates through image folders categorized as 'infected' and 'notinfected', extracting image paths and their corresponding labels. The code constructs a Pandas DataFrame named 'df' to store these image paths and labels. The DataFrame is initialized with two columns: 'image_path' and 'label'. The code demonstrates the initial and final rows of the DataFrame, showcasing the structure of the dataset. The dataset consists of images from the 'augmented -enhanced -pcos' directory, categorized into 'infected' and 'notinfected' classes. The purpose of this code is to provide a foundation for building a deep learning model for PCOS detection using ultrasound images, potentially employing the ImpalaCNN algorithm. The code serves as a starting point for data loading and preparation within a Kaggle notebook environment. The use of Pandas facilitates efficient data handling and organization, enabling further analysis and model development.

Key Concepts:

  • Detection of PCOS using image analysis.
  • Utilizing a deep learning approach for image processing.
  • Employing a multi-scale Retinex enhanced ultrasound technique.
  • Creation of a Pandas DataFrame to store image paths and labels.
  • Categorization of images into 'infected' and 'notinfected' classes.
